title.title: The Correspondence of John Hunt and Joshua Evans

msIdentifier.institution: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

projectDesc.p: The correspondence of Quaker ministers John Hunt and Joshua Evans are stored at the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College. With the generous support of H. David and Joyce E. Hunt, Library staff scanned and transcribed these letters in 2023 and encoded the text in TEI. The 2023 project also included researching individuals mentioned in the text to create and update records about them in the Social Networks and Archival Context website

body.p:
Your friendly message from Winthrop, came to my house in my absence, but I embrace the earliest opportunity of congratulating you, on your safe arrival in this part of the country, after so long a journey, I hope your tour has been as pleasant as you expected, & that you will not leave this part of the country without calling, & spending a little time at my house. I would with much satisfaction, wait on you at Vassalborough, did not my private affairs demand my whole attention until the time I must leave home, for Philadelphia, which will be within about twenty or twenty-five days; if you do not expect to return home as soon as I may probably be in Philadelphia, any letter or message you wish to send your family or friends, I shall be
happy in carrying & will delivering to your family when I tell you that I wish to see you and my house be assured, than is in not one of those empty compliments, which are too current in the world, but that I really am very desirous of seeing you.
